Overall Rationale for the Amendment 
The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring 
across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions 
of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the 
study

To align the number of days 
with the mention of zinc 
discontinuation elsewhere in the 
protocol

Overall Design 
This is a single-arm, open-label, repeat-dose study to evaluate the effects of ALXN
Disclosure Statement: This is an open-label,

Number of Participants: 
The sample size will be approximately

Intervention Groups and Duration: 
Treatment-experienced

Following screening and enrollment, 
participants will have a Run-in Period to support diet equilibration
Participants will have intake and output collection periods from Day -
Participants may be discharged from the clinical research unit

In this situation, participants will be given additional investigational product to support 
daily dosing throughout the Outpatient Period
Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations
k A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit

Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical 
examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator’s discretion
m While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast

As an outpatient, participants are expected to take 
ALXN
n During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration

In case of rechecks, and postdose serum 
chemistry, participants may not have fasted for
r Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -
s Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening
u Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified
v Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion
While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet
x For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample

When multiple procedures are scheduled to occur at the 
same time, the following order of events should be strictly adhered to whenever possible: ECG, vital signs, blood 
sampling

A minimal set of screen failure information is

Standards of Reporting Trials
Minimal information includes demography, screen failure details

If the study intervention is definitively discontinued, the 
participant should remain in the study to be evaluated for safety follow-up

criteria

The study staff should 
notify Alexion and their site monitor of all study withdrawals as soon as possible

• A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request, or may 
be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, 
compliance, or administrative reasons

• Immediate safety concerns should be discussed with Alexion immediately upon 
occurrence or awareness to determine if the participant should continue or 
discontinue study intervention

• All screening evaluations must be completed and reviewed to confirm that potential 
participants meet all eligibility criteria
• The following only applies to sites in the US

Some sites may perform screening procedures only and 
not any of the remaining study procedures

Site-to-site transfer of the participant will be documented 
accordingly

The copper and molybdenum concentration of each sample will be determined by inductively 
coupled plasma mass spectrometry

All participants will drink water from the same large water bottle 
dispenser
Samples will be collected, stored and shipped as detailed in the Laboratory Manual

All sample handling procedures will be documented in detail as 
described in the Laboratory Manual
Fecal samples will be individually collected, weighed, and stored
Pharmacokinetic collection should occur as close as possible to the scheduled time

• Blood pressure and heart rate measurements will be assessed with a completely 
automated device
• Vital signs will be measured in a supine position after

Vital signs will consist 
of a single pulse and blood pressure measurement

The average of the blood pressure readings will be 
recorded in the CRF

As with vital 
signs, if ECG interval measurements are abnormal, an additional triplicate will be 
performed and recorded in the CRF

• The Investigator must review the laboratory report, document this review, and record any 
clinically relevant changes occurring during the study in the AE section of the CRF

Clinically significant 
laboratory values are those deemed by the Investigator to be clinically significant 
resulting in further evaluation or treatment or those associated with an AE or clinical 
signs or symptoms

− If such values do not return to normal/baseline within a period of time judged 
reasonable by the Investigator, the etiology should be identified, and Alexion 
notified

− All laboratory values from non-protocol-specified laboratory assessments must 
also be recorded in the CRF
• Total molybdenum and PUF-molybdenum are surrogate measures of ALXN
• Excess/additional samples may be stored for up to
Blood samples will be collected as described in the SoA

Plasma samples will be used for ICP-MS measurement of total copper and 
PUF-copper, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and non-ceruloplasmin-bound copper 
measured via PUF-copper, and/or LBC, or assessed via NCC/NCCcorrected methods at the time 
points indicated in the SoA

End of Study Definition 
A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the 
study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities

Start times for

according to method used

Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of 
Activities

Screen Failures  
Screen failures are defined as participants who consent to participate in the clinical study but are 
not subsequently assigned to study intervention

Discontinuation of Study Intervention 
In rare instances, it may be necessary for a participant to permanently discontinue

Participant Discontinuation/Withdrawal From the Study 
• All efforts should be made to ensure participants are willing to comply with study 
participation prior to conducting the screening procedures

STUDY ASSESSMENTS AND PROCEDURES 
• Study procedures and their timing are summarized in the SoA
Efficacy Assessments

Copper and Molybdenum Balance Measurements 
Copper and molybdenum balance measurements will be made on all intake

Food and Fluid Collection for Copper and Molybdenum Concentrations 
Samples of all meal and fluid batches will be collected and analyzed for measurement of copper 
and molybdenum content

Urine Collection for Measurement of Copper and Molybdenum content 
Urine samples to measure copper and molybdenum content will be collected periodically as 
described in the SoA

Safety Assessments 
Planned time points for all safety assessments are provided in the SoA

Physical Examinations 
• A complete physical examination will include, at a minimum, assessments of the 
cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological systems

Vital Signs 
• Body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure

Electrocardiograms 
• Triplicate

Clinical Safety Laboratory Assessments 
• See Section

Samples collected for 
analyses of plasma concentrations may also be used to evaluate safety aspects related 
to concerns arising during or after the study

These samples will not be 
used for genetic analyses

Pharmacodynamics 
Plasma total and PUF-copper, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC will be 
assessed during the study

Genetics 
Genetics will not be evaluated in this study

Immunogenicity Assessments 
Not applicable

Health Economics Data and/or Medical Resource Utilization 
Health economic and medical resource utilization parameters are not evaluated in this study
